title: Woman doesn't hold back thoughts on 's***ty' plastic bra she wore for 30 seconds
text:

Some bras are designed for comfort and support, others are intended to look sexy.

Then there are bras that seem to serve absolutely zero purpose.

Take for instance, a clear plastic number currently being sold online by retailers such as Wish and Shein for £4.

The bizarre item has baffled shoppers and left customers very unhappy, if the reviews and Reddit posts about the bra are anything to go by.

A woman named Rahella Ray, who purchased the bra when it was being sold for the bargain price of £1.99, did not hold back her thoughts.

Replying to a post on Reddit, Rahella, who says she works as a stripper, branded the bra "s***ty".

She wrote: "So I bought this. Figured I’d take one for the team. It squashed my nipples and probably broke a rib in the process. My nips looked so sad behind that cheap plastic.

"They're s***ty plastic (baubles style), the kind that breaks when it's been pressed.

"Hooks are clear, straps are pingy death traps and the whole thing broke in 30 seconds.

"It was a wild ride and I hated it, all for £1.99."

On Shein's website, people confirmed her comments, saying the bra was "unwearable" and "horrible" in the review section, where the product has an average of 3.1 stars out of five.

Someone else said: "So bad, don't get it."

Another added: "Very hard plastic, almost like a water bottle. Also runs small."

Many people also reported that the plastic was broken by the time their order arrived and that the fit was very small.

Shein's customer service department has been responding to comments with the same message.

It reads: "Dear customer, Thank you so much for ordering from our site and we deeply apologize if our items did not live up to your expectation.

"We have strict quality assurance before each product is packed and shipped, making sure they are delivered to you as advertised. There might be slight difference between the real thing and the pictures on our website due to different light exposure and viewing screens, we’re sorry for the hassle. Feel free to contact reviews@shein.com if anything, we will get back to you very soon."

However not everyone had a poor experience, with some saying their bras had arrived in good condition and looked "nice".
description: Women have been slamming a rather bizarre clear plastic bra that's currently being sold online for £4
